The information you need will include things like: 

- proof of when you told your landlord or letting agent about the problem and copies of any letters and emails
- photographs of the problem 
- any evidence available from experts (eg surveyors, environmental health officers)
- your tenancy agreement 
- any relevant medical reports 
- details of any money you've paid costs incurred as a result of the disrepair.

### Getting an expert opinion ###

You may need to ask an expert to carry out an inspection and put together a report for the court. Particularly if the problem is complex, or you and your landlord don't agree. 

You may be able to share the cost of an expert opinion with your landlord, or claim the costs back if you win the case. 

Find out more about getting ready for court on the [Shelter website](https://england.shelter.org.uk/legal/housing_conditions/taking_action_on_disrepair/county_court_action/gathering_information)

heading: Getting ready for court
lede: You should try to gather as much information as you can before going to court.
